definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Ge You is an old stager in Chinese film industry.
sentences.chinese: 葛优是中国电影界的老戏骨。

sentences.english: Michael Gambon, another veteran of stage, screen and television, plays Lord Fox.
sentences.chinese: 老戏骨兼舞台和电视红人米高甘博今次扮演霍士爵士。

definition: (neologism c. 2014) celebrity with a huge, devoted fan base/celebrity with a huge following on social media
to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
role of vivacious young female in Chinese opera
